channel.title: New reverb options
channel.description: Quick suggestion: is it possible to add new styles of reverb? For instance, the reverb for most of the instruments sounds like a "large room" reverb. Is there a chance to add like a "stadium" reverb and/or "cathedral" reverb?

item.title: New reverb options
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
Reverb has actually been the weak point of iOS music, very resource hungry.

Read full topic

item.title: New reverb options
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I’ve got my eyes on a Strymon Big Sky.

Now, personally, I don’t understand how even a great hardware reverb can be as expensive as a decent entry-level analogue synth (~£425), but it sure sounds purdy — especially if paired up with that Moog Sub 37 I keep promising to buy myself.

Dayum!
Dayum!!
Aaah

Until then… I recently started looking at reverb apps like RF-1. Haven’t tried any out yet, but grabbed that and EOS 2 to try out.

With the processing power of modern mobile devices (far exceeding that of any FX pedal), I’d love to see Strymon or Eventide put out some reverb apps (Audiobus support included, natch). Even at not-‘cheap’ prices — I’m thinking £30–50 — I feel reasonably sure it’d be one of those ‘Shut up and take my money!’ moments for me.

Read full topic

item.title: New reverb options
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
For quality reverb, $50 is incredibly cheap. Buying that sound on hardware used to cost anywhere from 10 to 100 times as much

item.title: New reverb options
item.dc:creator: _undefined
item.description:
I’ve seen vahalla before. I’ve, however, never used it (I’m sounding like the people against the $5 soundpacks --> $50 dollars for easy reverb???). It would be awesome if it either was free or cheaper in auxy. Still, Vahalla sounds amazing and it would be awesome for them to help. @Auxy , have you looked at their other plug-ins for the PC studios?

Read full topic

item.description:
/Bump/ That would be a good idea

Read full topic

item.title: New reverb options
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
We currently have one reverb type (one algorithm) running in the app. For each sound we adjust the settings to fit with the sound as good as we can. Available settings are e.g. size, decay, damping, etc. That means we can create variations in how the reverb sounds. However, since we’re only using one algorithm, we’re limited to certain options in how the reverb sounds, and it’s not really possible to create a nice church reverb for instance.

In the future we’ll hopefully be able to:

  • Add some more flexibility for choosing reverb type for each sound. I.e. to let you guys pick if you want a small room or a large hall for each sound.

  • Add more reverb types to choose from. One example would be to integrate reverbs from https://valhalladsp.com. We just need to convince them to work with us.

Read full topic

item.title: New reverb options

item.description:
Quick suggestion: is it possible to add new styles of reverb? For instance, the reverb for most of the instruments sounds like a “large room” reverb. Is there a chance to add like a “stadium” reverb and/or “cathedral” reverb?
